qas.question: Where was the written law and the oral law transmitted?
Who spoke the words of the Torah to Moses?
What were the laws contained in the written Torah known as?
Where is Moses miraculously transported to?

answers.text: House of Study of Rabbi Akiva

qas.question: What law is held to be transmitted with an extremely high degree of accuracy?
Who holds that the Oral Law was not transmitted on Mt. Sinai?
What was given very few explanations on how to use it?
Which law is set so that no new rules are created from it?

plausible_answers.text: House of Study of Rabbi Akiva

qas.question: Where was Noah transported according to a story in the Talmud?
What law is not considered to have a high degree of accuracy?

context: <b5_0>Orthodox Judaism<b5_0/> holds that on <a0_0>Mount Sinai<a0_0/>, the Written Law was transmitted along with an Oral Law. The words of the Torah (Pentateuch) were spoken to Moses by <a1_0>God<a1_0/>; the laws contained in this Written Torah, the "<a2_0><b6_0>Mitzvot<b6_0/><a2_0/>", were given along with detailed explanations in the oral tradition as to how to apply and interpret them. Furthermore, the Oral law includes principles designed to create new rules. <b9_0>The <a4_0><b7_0>Oral law<b9_0/><b7_0/><a4_0/> is held to be transmitted with an extremely high degree of accuracy. Jewish theologians, who choose to emphasize the more evolutionary nature of the Halacha point to a famous story in the Talmud, where Moses is miraculously transported to the <a3_0><b8_0>House of Study of Rabbi Akiva<b8_0/><a3_0/> and is clearly unable to follow the ensuing discussion.
